title: The 2024 promotion of the Legion of Honor rewards eleven people who intervened during the Arras attack - timenews
text: 2023-12-31 07:50:39 Eleven people who intervened during the attack in Arras (Pas-de-Calais) on October 13, 2023, were knighted in the promotion of the Legion of Honor on January 1, published Sunday, December 31, at Official newspaper . Among them are six police officers and five staff from the Gambetta high school in front of which professor Dominique Bernard was stabbed to death by a radicalized former student. Immediately after this attack, the teacher was posthumously elevated to the rank of knight by the President of the Republic, Emmanuel Macron. In total, the new civilian promotion of the Legion of Honor, the highest of French national distinctions, rewards “on par” 352 people working “in the service of the general interest”, specifies the Grand Chancellery in a press release. Illustrious or unknown to the general public, these people are divided into different ranks (knights, officers, commanders, etc.). Two join the prestigious circle of grand crosses, the highest dignity of the Legion of Honor held by only 68 other people: the CEO of the world’s number one luxury company LVMH, Bernard Arnault, and the hematologist Dominique Meyer, member of the Academy of Sciences. Also read our investigation: Article reserved for our Legion of Honor subscribers, investigation into an opaque system Two Nobel Prize winners in physics rewarded Still in the sciences, two winners of the 2023 Nobel Prize in Physics, the Frenchman Pierre Agostini and the Franco-Swedish Anne L’Huillier, are promoted to commanders, as are the astronaut Jean-François Clervoy and the child psychiatrist Marcel Rufo. READ Also: The “republican arc”, a concept “intended to exclude some from the field of political legitimacy” Also read our portrait: Article reserved for our subscribers Anne L’Huillier and Pierre Agostini, Nobel Prize in physics and masters of infinitesimal time In the economic world, Jean-Michel Darrois, business lawyer, Colette Lewiner, director of EDF and the CGG oil services group, as well as David de Rothschild, honorary president of the R & CO bank, all three were promoted. great officer. The ministers and parliamentarians in office cannot be named, but the former centrist minister Jean-Louis Borloo is promoted to officer, and the former Castex government minister Elisabeth Moreno, president of Femmes@Numérique, becomes knight. The French ambassador to Iran, Nicolas Roche, former chief of staff to Jean-Yves Le Drian when he was minister of foreign affairs, was also knighted. In the sporting field, Michel Vion, secretary general of the International Ski Federation, is made an officer, while David Lappartient, president of the French National Olympic and Sports Committee (CNOSF), Marion Bartoli, sports consultant, Patrick Haddad, president of Red Star Football Club and audiovisual producer, Marc Keller, president of the Racing Club de Strasbourg, as well as Frédéric Michalak, rugby coach at Racing 92, join the knights. For the arts, the composer Vladimir Cosma was notably promoted to officer. The so-called promotion of January 1 and that of July 14 are the two annual civilian promotions of the Legion of Honor, which now has some 79,000 members. Two military promotions are also published, one in June-July for the active army, the other in October-November for reserve soldiers and veterans. In 2023, 1,858 people were recognized.
